6nhJG1dKS5IdeN7IzMyiMA.text: Pretty good food. The frozen custard is amazing  The employees are professional and kind. I'll definitely be back!

v7DnJp94zs0PUL-ZNTOMvg.text: Let me start by saying I have not had their food. I simply wanted ice cream. Their drive through process is so screwed up that getting ice cream is a pain- I can't imagine trying to wait for food with this set up. There is only room for maybe 1 or 2 cars to wait behind the person ordering in the drive through. Once you order you drive to the window and pay, then they toss a number at you and make you drive around to the front of the building. After 15 minutes (keep in mind we ordered one up of ice cream) I went inside to see what the issue was, only to find that they never brought it out to us and it was melted all down the side of the cup.

aIMIYDM41fYFgwIE24wXYg.text: I've never heard of Culver's but I'm glad I found it!  They have great food...cooked to order.  They actually listen and cook the food how you tell them.  It's rare now days to get good customer service, but they have perfected it at this location.  They greet customers and have a great attitude.  The restaurant is clean; including the bathrooms.  All fast food restaurants need to go by Culver's and take notes.

9d4mAlJwwlXpaJM4msltvA.text: I love Culver's, and coming from Wisconsin, this place made me feel at home. However, I just felt like their service is not up to par. I spent almost $25, and they of course forgot some of my items. I didn't notice until I got home. So, when I tried to call their phone to let them know, it rang a few times and went to voicemail. It's saddening when one of my favorite places can't even answer the phone. I probably won't be going back for a while because apparently no one is running the place. The food is great, but when the service is terrible, I'd rather go somewhere else.

PZhTi6qUCig4qho34316QA.text: OMG so I'll admit I just love a good greasy burgers, so this place hit the spot! Let's top that with frozen custard and a deal a struck each and every time.  Prices were comparable to other spots so no complaints there and the place was clean; what more could I ask for!

Zm4PxdfeiXIWC14BkfV8KQ.text: There. Is. A. Culver's. In. North. Carolina.   Ok, I got that out of the way up front.  I was at Ikea and I saw the Culver's sign ... and did the double take about what state I was in, so I was drooling for my butter burger before I even got past the Swedish checkout counter.  Sure beats flying to Minneapolis to get good Midwestern food.

H8fxQr55euamot4tEHp6Rg.text: Good, quick meal. Girl at counter made suggestions for combo for best price. You order at counter, get number and food is brought to you. Good onion rings, a little on the salty side. Husband enjoyed fish sandwich. I had a cheeseburger single. It was Sunday and gospel music was playing. First time there so I don't know if that's the normal soundtrack or just special for Sunday.

dQ7QLQbDNeMwPmC4prSo2g.text: The lemon ice is to die for!! I tried the mango,strawberry, lemon ice!!!  Delish! Custard is always good!

ikepzpxnGIJgs7CYNGMSdQ.text: I love Culver's, grew up in Wisconsin and was so excited when it opened!  The staff at this location is awesome

SeJT0teAkelekfhGZQ1Rjg.text: My husband and I came here after an IKEA trip. They've only been open 3 days but the Culver's standard is strong at this location. The food was great and it was delivered by smiling kids. They got my dessert size wrong but I'm chalking that up to that fact that everyone is new and still learning the POS system. It's dangerous that we have a Culver's closer to us now though.

d86KmHp2tRB-jwdKJDlVoQ.text: Great service, great hamburger , cheese curds were awesome. What more need I say. My New favorite fast food place.

IYoGv-feRUCmrcpsBLVizA.text: Love the great quality food, especially for the price! There are plenty of staff who are very eager to help. The dining room was packed but they were there helping clear tables and wipe them down. Although it took about 15 minutes to get our food, they are new, so it was fine with me. My food was hot and delicious. After having a minor problem with my order I brought it to their attention, and the way they handled it is another reason they are getting 5 stars. I truly enjoyed my experience and will be back!

IXCsq5MU8kcbY6gUcZliYg.text: I enjoyed my lunch at Culver's.  Having eaten at other Culver locations several times, I knew what to order - a single, deluxe burger.  This time I tried a chocolate shake that had great flavor, but it was a bit too thick for me to drink through the straw.  Next time I'll stick with having my Culver's ice cream as a dessert.  This location is very, very popular and I recommend entering from the Ikea side of the parking lot so as not to be blocked by the long line of cars at the drive through window.

1ZYguY0mwPGb1jHw7z4uxA.text: First time experience at Culver's and was pleasantly surprised. Service at the counter was very friendly and helpful. The establishment was clean (location is new). Burgers were tasty and loved the fries. The malt (hard to find in other restaurants) was the perfect treat to top off the meal. Highly recommend.

vvEMk5RWUWTbDDbOTVZpBQ.text: The food here is awesome! I love the ice cream! The lines are a little long, but they move pretty quick. The employees are very friendly. Great place to take a family to dine.

_yrBgw_TVPjrCcHMTCVNcQ.text: very good restaurant and also good milkshakes and ice cream. i used to go to the culvers  in South carolina and the burgers are good. I'll be definitely coming back  to this restaurant

N_k0qVwHttqNWzoEByO1dw.text: If I could give them zero stars I would... we went through the drive through ordered two burgers and two cheese curds.. pretty simple order I would say....They gave us our number and we waited with everyone else in line to get our food. Pretty ridiculous system if you ask me... 20 minutes go by and all the cars behind us which was was about 5 ...ALL got there food before us!! So I go inside to speak to a "manager" if that's what you want to call him and I tell him what is going on and tell him id like a refund.. he doesn't seem to care that I am upset and he offers me free custard which I don't think is appropriate for how long we just had to wait for our food. I told him I wanted a refund and he then proceeded to ask me what we got, which I told him..and then mentioned that it's ridiculous that we waited 20 minutes to get our food while everyone else behind us got there food first. Again, doesn't seem to care at all...He goes over to look to see when the order was placed because apparently he didn't believe that I waited that along and then comes back and said to me "it just hit the 20 minute mark and that I've been standing here for about 4 of those minutes"!!! Really?!! Is this really how you are going to speak to a customer! This place has the worst customer service especially when the so called manager tries to argue with me and then still doesn't do anything about my unhappiness. If he is the manager then he should be fired... that is very poor to treat your customers like that! I will be calling corporate because I feel like the way I was treated and how everything was handled was unacceptable. I do not recommend this place to anyone... the food and service are both horrible!

LCWGm1c34WCI-3WTyFtLjg.text: As you can see from my first 40 reviews I'm from Illinois and moved here last year. I'm so glad there's a couple Culver's around here. The butter burgers are outstanding. The custard shakes are great. I think what tops those but not by much is the cheese curds. Where are you getting cheese like this anywhere? I give these guys a 5 every time. The servers take your garbage so you can put your arms on the table and talk with the people you're with.

aIb-wMCB_NHHJKqTWarxXA.text: I go to this Culver's regularly and I have never had a bad experience. The employees there have awesome cutomer service. Especially Maury and Megan.

bGdzcB3_qog2Ajkm-Kyzpg.text: Food is good, service is friendly, but if using the drive through make sure to physically check your order, don't just confirm using your receipt. On two of the three occasions I've gotten home to find problems with my drive through order.

1zNZOK7b2eC3ryhnKrDKQg.text: Not sure what others are raving about...this was a greasy flavorless mess.  Drive thru was slow and one you pay you have to drive around to wait 5-10 mins.  Tried tenders..salty and highly breaded.  Fish plate..no flavor and super greasy. Fries were pretty good though.  Stick to Zaxbys across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greasy yuck..ate inside but never again

gpze0NX7UXZ6Kvg7zcYgRw.text: I ordered a double cheese burger meal. The cheeseburger was good and tasty . I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double cheeseburger

-RCQFQgUjwAjxdBLkamuJw.text: The wait may take a little longer than other fast food restaurants but it's totally worth it!  Real meat in the burgers, crunchy crinkle fries, and perfectly battered fish will not let you down. The custard is great and there are tons of flavors. The cheese curds are growing in me lol.

VZMdT7Mrle1qgBDmnJdgqw.text: Driving through and wanted to try someplace new ...   I have never heard of Culver's, but saw the parking lot and drive-thru were packed.  Figured I would give it a shot.  The burgers are huge, plenty of flavor, and lots of toppings. The cheese bites are amazing. The onion rings are almost as good as the cheese bites (I am a fan of cheese, so kinda partial here to the bites). The chicken tenders are good, I suggest the Buffalo tenders dipped in ranch with Frank's Red Hot - so good!  The have a killer diet root beer ... I know what you are thinking, I just loaded up my heart with fried foods only to get a diet root beer - don't judge me (LOL).  Look forward to returning, suggest anyone check it out.

Nw6SFUrNNTKU0uK2nSt66Q.text: They bring you your food. They check on you. The staff is friendly and helpful. Love this place. Love the fish. I want to come back to taste the burgers. Nice and spacious eating area. Reminds me of Zaxbys meets Chick fil a.

eeejGvW9AubEUYlMyMW3Tw.text: When you go to the drive thru they give you a hang tag and ask you to pull around the building and they will bring your order to you.  There is nothing more irritating to me than to be told to pull up at the drive thru.  The  burger was very good it certainly made up for the wait.  The burger was just made and was great.

vpM9j7yn_9whMQ5uIMXdhw.text: Staff was extremely friendly, burger was "ok." The buffalo chicken tenders are just spicy breading and were not very good. I waited probably 20 mins to order then another 10 for them to make mediocre food. I'd be willing to try again, maybe when I have a few hours to kill, but try and pick up the pace.

eN-mn-XZUvXqnW5cthzpag.text: Customer service was great. Staff was very helpful and attentive. It's like the Wisconsin version of chick fil a....except with beef. Cheese curds, burgers and Ice cream (egg custard as they call it in Wisconsin) were great!!! I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The cheese curds were pretty dang good!

uJ7kiG5mwz-GNLXrOal7tA.text: Great place to eat! This was my first time and the burgers, cheese curds, and custard were amazing.

nrnaujoAJENUGqgNtbq4GQ.text: Extremely poor customer service.  I ordered my food and only half of my order came out after waiting for about 10 mins one of the food runners came over and asked did I order a "mushroom and swiss" burger.  I said no but I haven't received the remainder of my order this went on for about 5 mins.  Then a man came out and stated my food wasn't rang up and of course I was so frustrated because I had waited in line for so long.  He asked me what I wanted and I stated what I ordered earlier then he was like how are you going to pay for it.. At this time I'm like "what" I gave her my payment earlier and at the very least you should comp it for my trouble/time and I really felt I did pay for it earlier. Looking back on it I think they entered it as the mushroom and swiss the girl asked me about earlier.  The guy was so rude I asked for his information and he stated I'm the owner.. ok.. that's even worst for him to act in that manner.. extremely unprofessional.  I told him I will write a review and he said "do what you have to do" so I did. Word of advice check your receipt better yet don't go because it's not worth the frustration!

eCREbTJIk6QUOkgSq2lQrg.text: Near perfect fast food. A great, hot, juicy burger cooked to perfection. The fries, onion rings and cheese curds (more on these later) have always come out hot and fresh, like they were cooked to order.  The custard is excellent. I recommend not getting a shake, but instead getting a Concrete Mixer, as it seems to be more value for the price and isn't milky/melted like the shakes.  The cheese curds are great. Think fried mozzarella bites, but with a rubbery, squeaky quality to them. These are great. Their fries, while good, are "just" crinkle cut and not fresh cut, so I always get the Curds as my side instead.  Prices are actually pretty decent. You can get a burger, fries and drink (even if upgrading to custard, like I do, instead of a drink) will set you back around $8-12 depending on the number of patties or fancy toppings or premium sides.

8pHVPEGCStsa-HIejMHGEA.text: Friendly staff, great food, and clean atmosphere!  First time visiting a Culver's so I had to order the original butter burger, it was freaking delicious! The fries were a bit undercooked, but they were still good. All around I would visit this establishment again.

6-3gMcWi6pCldNUwBkiHqg.text: Omg this place is absolutely amazing friendly fast and CLEAN!!!!! i love how fast and friendly they are for drive thru and Jennifer has the most pleasant and professional voice ever and super sweet young lady my dining experience here is amazing as well they have someone to make sure you have everything you need and as a courtesy to you they throw your trash away they are super clean!!!!!!!!!!!! Too clean!!!!

RK8w-uJxbePJWMtY1T-s-w.text: The service is very slow. I was the only car in the drive-thru & it took 10 minutes to make my sandwich. I didn't order any sides, just a sandwich & it still took 10 minutes. I went at 11am on a Saturday & there were several workers standing around doing nothing.

WLj56NKKutygwqCWOBniOg.text: I am In burger love. They are fantastic. Have the necessary crusty goodness. Bread is toasted. Toppings fresh. I am partial to the mushroom Swiss and the bacon adding the mushrooms. Omg those onion rings. Yummy. I had the fish it was flaky and crunchy and had a cheese slaw . It was on a sub roll. Most time you order it's brought out to the red tag on your door. Hot fresh delicious. I like them. Better than 5 guys because cost and quality Culvers wins. Don't forget taste . Yummmmmmmyyy mmm mmmm

fJ6gCy3pon1tC00I-ygFnw.text: Not only was my pub burger awesome, and soup just hit the spot, but best part about this place are the people who work here. They were friendly, helpful, and welcoming.  We very much enjoyed our dinner.

M6fKKCtHg6sOF5m_6u3L0A.text: Wonderful customer service we enjoyed all the food fun and fellowship. Mushroom burger and concrete mixer were fabulous

R01patb9nw1smZGmsLRang.text: Prices were good and service was quick. The burger patties were burned badly to the point of being crunchy along the edge, and ruined an otherwise well put together and tasty sandwich.

-O5a-dLeUqaFmAPGslGgEQ.text: Traveling back home from Pro Football Hall of Fame on spring break with family heading back to Georgia and this place was recommended. Great suggestion. Prices were very reasonable and kids meal even came with a cup or scoop of custard. I would highly recommend for any family with kids or adults that want good food with great family environment !!

KvzshQhBKcZRneOBLgGWvw.text: Culver's milkshakes are second to none but both times I've been to this one they've screwed up my order. First time I waited a long time and they gave me someone else's order, which happened to be more food than I ordered so no harm no foul but the second they gave my order to someone else and I had to wait twice as long. Still love Culver's, just not this one.

n4Rqw-4sBJtv2DpSwHEu_Q.text: Loved this place! We need one in Winston Salem, NC Butter Burger and Vanilla Custard with Peaches....so tasty.

phYaCIrhGpKrzF_puVAjiA.text: Enjoyed the burgers and fries. A great flace for some quality fast food. The icecream is pretty good. Great food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

oVMgU6WKKyKxfcTVUKLYyw.text: Saw this (see pic) at the drive thru and ordered "cheese fries".  I got chili cheese fries instead.  Ok, mistakes happen.  But I was basically scolded that I had ordered incorrectly because I did not say cheese sauce.  Wait! I didn't say chili either!  When I pointed out how this could be confusing I was scolded again for being rude. Talk about poor customer relations, this was the poster child for how not to treat people.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

rs4cwq9z49-O80HlwcAndw.text: Just stopped in to try this place out and it was great. I ordered a few things to try out. Grilled Reuben melt without coleslaw. Beef pot roast sandwich with gravy on the side. (Added a lot) Chicken tenders and also the ButterBurger Cheese with only ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise and pickles. I was surprised it was all great... For dessert ordered a mint chocolate chip shake and a pumpkin spice Shake. The Pumpkin Spice wasn't really good So ended up trading it out for a vanilla Reese's and brownie bits it was a lot better.. :) The Customer service was excellent here... The Best service we ever had anywhere for a fast food restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

Nmr0ASjB7VZh2kTLo5LFqw.text: I've never been to one of these establishments before so my expectations were nonexistent. Culver's went above and beyond that low bar of mine. Good food. Excellent and speedy service. The atmosphere felt relaxed, even for how packed the place was, it never slinked into complete bedlam. I was especially impressed with the gluten-free bun, which was savory and flavorful like it has been grilled in butter. Side note: Since this fast food joint permits open carry, expect to see patrons with pistols strapped to their cargo shorts. While this isn't much of an issue, being caught unawares of the situation could give you a slight shock at a family restaurant as you stuff your face hole with the delectable crispy fries Culver's offers. But this detail is trivial and by no means detracts from the place or prevents me from visiting the establishment again. If pressed, I'd say it only adds flavor of the whole Culver's experience. The one reason I dropped a star is because the ice machine didn't work and the iced tea was served warm. But, my wife loves the chicken.

SFiZF2yi8cR1v5bAp1vUAw.text: Finally got to try out Culver's after hearing so much about it. I ordered the Culver's Deluxe (Double Cheeseburger) with fries and a vanilla shake. The burger was ok. You can tell they use fresh ingredients which is good. The fries were good and were cooked perfectly. The highlight of the meal was the vanilla shake. It's probably one of the best milkshakes I've had. Will definitely return to get a shake and maybe try something else on the menu.

hm4lLNY4oMQACQJ5LtXInA.text: One of the few places I will eat a burger. I love the option of cheese curds instead of fries. 1.30 upcharge a little steep though.   Great option for a bite after Ikea shopping.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Center room. Sometimes has a real channel playing.

LugBpOvhGz_lmdbDZr6Ovw.text: Terrible customer service. Refused to put BBQ sauce on my cheeseburger.

WDbPj8VUIv0tiZCZhxTN2Q.text: Let's be clear, this review is just for the raspberry frozen custard. It isn't fancy or homemade but it was so good I ate one portion and then went through the drive thru to get a second one. Now, that downside of daily flavors is now I have to wait a month to get the precious raspberry flavor again. That's ok, I'll wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Raspberry custard single scoop

Ok6b-QJTxbwicjPH85rXLg.text: Such a perfectly delicious burger. This is steak and shake on steroids. Everything about my experience was awesome from the beginning. I've been eyeing the progress on Culver's since they started construction months ago. I'd never eaten here a day in my life but I had a feeling it was going to be amazing. And it was everything I wanted it to be and more. I came through the drive through and was warmly greeted. Took a minute to peruse the menu and asked for a suggestion before I placed my order. Per the pleasant cashier's suggestion, I opted for a double butter burger with cheese and no onion, fries and a root beer. The wait was short to get to the window and the pleasant demeanor never faded. She asked that I pull around as they prepared the meal to order. After less than 10 minutes my meal was delivered curbside. I almost waited until I arrived to my destination to eat it but for in order to give you my Yelp loves the quality review you deserve, I pulled over in the Culver's parking lot to devour my delicacies...you're welcome.   The burger was perfectly creamy and juicy piled with fresh toppings. The beef is not your average fast food patty. It is clearly from fresh beef and the perfect inconsistency of shape (and the obviously perfect fat to lean ratio in the meat) gave the edges a divine crispiness that is unparalleled. The fries were absolutely amazing. Perfectly salted, crispy and crunchy outside but hot creamy potato goodness inside. Then I got to wash it all down with a creamy root beer. Best of all this delicious meal set me back less than $8!!!   This place is quality indeed. This is now my new go to spot for a great burger in general.   Great job Culver's University team! You've gained a loyal client today.

gKfJjXd3CI4e4AQEntdULA.text: Today was the first time I've been to Culver's. I tried the Wisconsin swiss melt, onion rings, and an order of cheese curds. Everything was delicious! The Swiss melt was soooo cheesy and awesomely greasy lol. The onion rings were flavorful and crisp. I must admit though, i wanted to try the cheese curds the most. I heard very good things about them and they lived up to their hype. I was even impressed with the nice woman who worked the drive-thru. It was refreshing to deal with someone who didn't seem like they were upset with the world. Culver's has made a new fan today.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

vKp3bNIfLWDUGFtxhHmtHg.text: Quick service.  Quality food.  Great fries.  I have not been disappointed yet.  I would rather spend my money here instead of Burger King or Hardee's.

aWhCijUGlVjijPT9NNS0_Q.text: Fresh food, refreshingly friendly service! Thumbs up! It's an excellent standout affordable food choice amongst a sea of mundane average mediocre food establishments  in Charlotte, most of whom have horrific service and rude employees. Thanks Culver's for putting customers first.

Q0yY8l6gB3IUjXeOl-yfiw.text: So excited to see this restaurant here! Best chocolate shakes and butter burgers around!!

MJZSvfIbrDoGekb4B0hdxA.text: Exactly what a Culver's is. Good, greasy food at good prices. Service here is pretty quick and definitely polite.

ICSNrjdA0ryve7Mp8ZCLeQ.text: The nicest most customer friendly fast food place I've ever been to. The food is great, fairly priced, and service was quick. We'll be coming back for sure, these guys are the future of fast food! Shoutout to Dan the owner who was super friendly to us as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

_CQIRV_4_tQEeiVRDU6uuQ.text: Customer service is freaking amazing ! Great food, great staff, great location. Place is very clean and fast! Will for sure be back !

7EnsMxC4ShKz4Iz3nb5dBQ.text: Great butterburgers, salads, cheese curds, Culver's brand root beer and check out the flavor of the day custard! Service is friendly & they bring your order to the table, which is nice, especially if you have little kids. The atmosphere is a bit cozier than most fast food places.  The location in front of Ikea is a bit tricky to get to. Coming down University from the East, go past Ikea Blvd and Zaxbys and turn in the Culver's driveway. From the West you have to hook a U-turn at the light and then go past Zaxbys, turning into the next driveway at Culver's. Otherwise you can take the scenic route down Ikea Blvd, make a U-turn and turn onto the road that runs behind the restaurants.

VAsjCHsTCFLIGF2-Nwff5Q.text: Amazing Double Mushroom Burger with a Chocolate Concrete Mixer with Hot Fudge and Reese's Cups!!! Live life- don't count the calories!!!

IRrGRiAnpBWNeZptVkfziQ.text: Terrible service!  No one was willing to help with selections.  Apparently you were expected to know a piece of lettuce does not come standard on a $6 hamburger combo.  No one tells you what comes on it.  Food was okay at best.  Ketchup tasted watered down.  Never going back.

KoKVoZHm7ZttbYUhx7kg0A.text: The burger was ok. It could've been a bit juicier because it tasted a bit dry, but other than that I thought it was fine. The fries were pretty good as well. I have to say that I really liked the sweet tea. It was perfect. I'd been passing the location near IKEA since it was built, but never had so I thought I'd go by today. The staff were extremely friendly to say the least. Maybe I'll try them again and try a chicken sandwich... who knows.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crinkle fries
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deluxe burger

osmKLLWBmfeNJv3pEgDzxw.text: Ummm one word unimpressed... they have a huge menu with mainly burgers and chicken tenders. I tried the tenders and the BF had the single burger. Everything is cooked fresh and came out quickly. My tenders weren't bad but they weren't good either... the French fries were good! The burger looked similar to Freddy's (but didn't match in taste) and according to the BF they didn't give much toppings (i.e tomato, pickles). It was okay but I will not be rushing back.

hWNc4YYtYqrssfq9UtF95A.text: First time here and it's delicious.  I had the double bacon burger basket. The fries were fresh and the burger was cooked to order. The cashiers were very friendly and attentive.  The restaurant was very clean. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining Area
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double Bacon burger

0bTdWzNoaG6uHbzBSuCaSw.text: So I finally tried the cod last week, and I would strongly recommend it. It was lightly battered, crisp, and the fish itself was beautiful and flaky. I honestly was very impressed, and I would definitely get it again. The service is still top notch, and I do find it funny that, while Culver's is known for their burgers and their frozen custard, it's the other items on their menu - like the Reuben and the cod - that I think they excel at. I would recommend this to anyone, although personally, I would look beyond the burger menu and try some of their other dishes. :-)

9wCmeEt6eMcgYAPR_61Efg.text: I love the burgers at Culver's. Hands down...the best place for burgers at a chain restaurant. All of their burgers have that slightly crispy exterior while being nice and tender on the inside. They also have nice compliments to go with the burgers. The staff is very friendly and yet professional despite being mostly high schoolers and/or college kids. You can get a really good burger and be in and out in no time. Also, the shakes are very good. They taste like their homemade and not made from a powder like some places. You can't go wrong at Culvers.

s_HFgS-9m42UrVzyk9ZXQQ.text: Fast service, great food. Polite workers. Awesome flavors of custard that changes daily. I only wish they had a lettuce wrap burger option for people who can't have bread.

l-wWdLKypfE9-7z65KQ1pg.text: The food is hot and fresh. The ice cream was enough to end my love of Coldstone creamery because the cookie dough here is amazing and isn't stale like I experienced at Coldstone. The butterburgers are delicious! Also, if you haven't tried the cheese curds yet, you are missing out- they are little pockets of deliciousness!   Dan, the owner, is a kind and driven guy with an amazing staff behind him. They welcome you and make sure your dining experience is everything that it should be. If you ever experience anything less than perfect, Dan won't hesitate to make it right. I would call the level of service at this restaurant "the Chick-fil-a experience". That is hard to find in Charlotte, but these guys are getting it down pact.   If you haven't gone yet, this place should be in your list to try. We will definitely be back.

C1H8EVis7A7ot5XO7bBujQ.text: This place is a gem! I had a burger with no bread and fries. I love their customer service. They greet you, they're friendly, they're patient. They have some of the best french fries I have ever had. Mine were fresh and hot, tasty... not too salty. They were absolutely perfect! When you have to wait for your food, they give you something to hang on the side of your car door and bring the food out to you. Thank you for a great experience!

86V56OTmkxVJDsv5WJHuCg.text: Butter burgers and custard.  Order at the counter, and they give you a number and bring your food out when it's ready. This means a little bit of a wait if it's busy. But the food is always hot and fresh. I prefer the mushroom & Swiss double, with a custard to go afterwards.  Custard flavors are vanilla, chocolate, and a rotating flavor of the day. Available as shakes, Concretion mixers ( think DQ Blizzard) or sundaes also.  One of the best Midwest burger chains expands south.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mushroom &amp; Swiss basket
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

avfAOXfGx42ES7vyc_oAqQ.text: Delicious Reuben sandwich and burger; service was excellent and the staff very friendly.

8RJbNH1ul79E9C4ho_bhLQ.text: Placed my order around 6:15 ish, got settled in a booth quickly after. There was a little mix up in the kitchen with my order; as they brought out the wrong entree twice, but the manager came over and gave me the second entree (the wrong one) for free, apologized profusely before heading back to the kitchen to get my order straightened out. It was only about another 10 min before my burger finally arrived, the manager along with it. He was very nice, even offered me a free dessert for my patience.   I ordered the Mushroom Swiss burger, the double, so it came with two patties, and a side of fries and a fountain drink. It was surprisingly very good for a semi-fast food restaurant. Enjoyed it, along with my company of friends. The manager then came back and gave me two menus full of desserts, even taking the time to pull up a chair and explain a few of the options. Very good service to make up for the mixups in the kitchen, made for an enjoyable first time dining experience at this Culver's.

zOykMLPhN3fvOHxqBU5fPg.text: If you want a down home all American burger place try Culvers. We got introduced to them in MN years ago. We loved it when we moved to Charlotte and found out they are in this area. One of our favorite casual places. Burgers are great, service is good and you have to have some custard and the toppings! Don't leave without it.

_mx5VGRMf4WQcFkFYJZd7A.text: Friendly service from a super nice gal at the counter who was kind and polite, as I was very overwhelmed by the massive menu board of burgers and custards and drinks.  I eventually settled on two burgers and a small chocolate malt, placing my order and being given a number for my table even though it was to go. Nice to be able to sit comfortably while waiting.  It didn't take long and the same gal brought my bag of food to me with a nice smile and I was off. I got about five minutes down the road before I started to wonder why they would have put the malt in the bag with the hot food. It turns out that they had not. I'll take come blame for that, I should have at least checked. Oh, well.  Burgers at home were perfect. Cooked just right and the fries were still nice and crisp. Crinkle cuts always do well with ketchup. My wife *loved* it.  I'll still be back to Culver's. I'll remember to check my order next time though.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Culver&#39;s by IKEA in Charlotte
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Culver&#39;s dining room
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The menu board is nuts at Culver&#39;s

ohRyPQayBgsJUBcYkl1zHw.text: Wow! I'm impressed! Not only did they fulfill my burger craving,but their customer service was excellent! On numerous occasions we had staff stop by our table to make sure we were enjoying our meal. One of them was the Owner, who briefly chatted with us. It says a lot about a business when the owner is willing to get his hands dirty with his employee.     The burger was delicious! Soft bun, fresh bacon and perfectly cooked crinkle fries. The Rueben Melt was also delicious. I will definitely return and recommend to anyone craving a solid burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rueben Melt
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crinkle fries

Qmy6liKWt6fg8tj01n0r2A.text: Think Bob Evans decides to go fast food and you'll get a feel.  Culver's is a nicely appointed restaurant with salads, shakes, burgers, and chicken or fish sandwiches.  Not your McDs or Burger King kinda joint.   My experience was pleasant, the line moved along, and plenty of seating available.  I liked the TV'S in the dining area, too (which I typically loathe).  Granted the place opened recently so it's in great shape; morever, my salad was prepared well (not artisan level but solid), the chicken tender and tasty.  Tip: nutritional information posted on My Fitness Pal.  A guy named Dan visited each table when things slowed inspecting how they're doing.  Discovered later he was the owner, blue hat, shirt, and everything. I like that.   I rarely eat much of their other stuff so I cannot comment, but if tempted I'd give that burger a try.  Or, the pot roast sandwich.  No, the fish.  Yes, with fries and a strawberry shake!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Cashew salad

hrzAn9_13Pmtimxc5I48lg.text: While reviewing yelp for places to eat near my hotel, I saw Culvers and the cheese curds got me. I had to go and get my fix for dinner one night! Lots of people in the parking lot, and I went with the bacon cheeseburger with cheese curds. With a drink it came out to a little over $9. I asked for ranch instead of the marinara sauce that came with the curds and was told to drive up and wait for my food. A young boy (maybe 10?) came out with the food but when I saw marinara, I asked to replace with ranch. He happily said he would bring it out and I had to pull up more as the drive thru kept getting longer.  The burger was really tasty, for a fast food joint, it was good quality. The cheese curds were as good as can be!!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curds!
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese curds
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon cheeseburger deluxe

rwh0eFQ0U9B0XHs0QUy_Mg.text: I wanted some frozen custard so off we went. The line in the drive through was super long and it took a while to move but once it started moving, it went fast. The lady taking our order was very friendly, super patient.   I ordered a kids meal for my son - the butter burger with cheese. I will say that I asked him for a bite and ended up taking two. That burger was so good! When we come back, I will definitely get a burger for myself. I don't know what their secret is but that burger was good.   The frozen custard was everything. They messed up my order but I didn't feel like being bothered with going back inside. I was supposed to get two chocolates but they only gave me one. They did give me an extra free custard with the order so I guess that is why I didn't go inside to fix it. They tried. But the custard is creamy and smooth and very flavorful. I just love custard.  And we ordered the cheese curds. These were everything too. I didn't want to share. Minus the initial shock of paying $3 and some change for a little serving of it - it ended up being a lot of curds in the bag.   When we want to treat ourselves I will definitely be back.

HwaCx5cTgjnY979zU4VXQQ.text: Culvers is pretty cool. I gave them a 4 star because they are a little expensive. They have a menu full of variety from butter burgers to ice cream custard with a colossal amount of toppings! My daughter said the cheese curds taste better than the fried cheese bites at Zaxby's so if you don't know what to get, try those! Happy Culvering, signed undercover fat girl!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. LARGE CHEESE CURDS!
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. LARGE CHEESE CURD packaging

WJM5F-yHuIox3aDlsDPNpw.text: Double Mushroom and Swiss was EVERYTHING!!!!! Service was great, just rude customers jumping in line. But overall experience was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

dzcDhpNGRkcVt_pEAHjVwg.text: Culver's is right up there with Chick Filet. The food is fresh and flavorful. The Frozen Custard is the best you've ever had. You receive old fashioned customer service and you never feel like they are rushing you or that you are just a "number". Many other restaurants could take notice of training their staff as well as they do here. The location is great however I wish they would open one up near Concord Mills.

di7CosdJA28cbzMnvaHaDg.text: Went today to get the cod sandwich only to find out that they actually have cod fish basket and dinner options without the bread! Yes!   You can get up to three pieces in the dinner with two sides, tarter, cocktail sauce, and a roll. The basket is either one or two pieces with fries and a drink.

iUakvb59KmhCnAR2WWXQbA.text: I'm definitely a fan of this North Carolina food chain....they have probably the best fish sandwich meal I've ever tasted.   We decided to stop by this restaurant location this past weekend as we visited Carowinds amusement park. We decided to utilize their drive thru and their staff was very courtesy and professional. Our food came out fast and hot. Everything was seasoned very well and both my spouse and I truly enjoyed everything.   I'm positive that we will be back in the near future. I would highly recommend it to friends and family members who want to have some good fast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

X_ETuVdN-gU6DM1aD7MFsA.text: Until today I had never been to a Culver's.  I used the Yelp app to talk me into giving it a try.  It was pretty good for fast food.     The restaurant, itself, is somewhat new.  It appears clean and tidy in the dining area.  There is a sanitation grade of 97 posted near the registers.  The drink and condiment station was very tidy.  The floors were free from noticeable dirt and debris.  The restrooms were clean and smelled clean.     The employees were very friendly.  You order at the register, take a number, and then they deliver your meal to the table.  All of this happened as planned and in a timely manner.  Our orders were correct and warm.     I ordered a beef roast sandwich.  It was really good.  My wife got a single patty mushroom swiss burger basket.  It was also good and the fries that came with it were also good.  Next time I want to try the cheese curds.  They also sell ice cream that looks great and everything was reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef roast sandwich
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

t8ij-7xpd29rUuPL_0vUeg.text: This is my first time at Culver's and it was pretty good for fast food! The service is really good, and the food was pretty fresh to order. It is a little pricey so you can't expect to pay MCD prices but it's worth it.

k9pEm_b3hHq30D3M_3bazg.text: Yum! Now THAT'S a tasty burger. I'm glad I watched Review Brah's YouTube review of Culver's. The burger looked soo good I had to try it. I was definitely not disappointed neither was the rest of my family. Tasty well seasoned burgers, awesome spicy chicken strips, crispy salty crinkle fries, and fried cheese curds. It was all great and had me wishing we had ordered more. Their house root beer was really good as well.   The staff was also very friendly. We'd never been before and the guy working the register gave some good recommendations and didn't rush us at all.   We'll be back. Too bad the closest culvers is 45 mins away and this one is about 3 hours from us.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy chicken strip.
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deluxe single. That&#39;s not a frozen preformed patty.
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. They brought this stuff over for my 3 yo

8jrug0O05Nt2iA7G2CZtAw.text: A new(er) fast food burger/chicken chan restaurant known for specialty burgers and a custard that is delicious.  They have featured custards each day/week that are fabulous.  You can ask for a taste test.  You can buy the custard by the cup or cone AND by the pint. 3 pints for $10.00.  Oh sorry, back to the "food".   I really like the burgers.  They have "butter burgers". My favorite is the cheddar butter burger with bacon.  I wish I could eat the double cheddar butter burger with bacon but I go for the single. My boys always go for the double burger.  Anyway you have to try the burger.  They have several chicken, salad, and seafood options as well.  Several sides allows you to add to any sandwich.   Stop by Culver's before you head into IKEA....you will get plenty of steps shopping the store where you can walk off any calories you took in!  Lol  Enjoy!

KpL9q-mLuri6VjbBCmJbSg.text: This place is such a treat. Honestly for a fast food joint this is really one of the best out there. Burgers are really good, Sometimes I even get the Cod and that is so good too. Custards, concrete's you name it they all look so good. Now for the icing on the cake those freaking Curds! Man they are so delicious and I usually need to order the large they are seriously that good.   The restaurant itself is nice and clean. They have outdoor seating and bathrooms weren't dirty. overall really a nice place to enjoy some good burgers, Cheese Curds, and ice cream.

LUQfgBc1xgF9MZz-7gHamQ.text: Came here enroute from the NC mountains. Very convenient and in the same area as IKEA. the butter burger was hot and juicy with a good portion of meat. Fries came out hot and crispy on the outside. The chicken tenders were fresh and not greasy. The place was clean with tvs and plenty of staff. Good service. Really impressed with this fast food restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Butter burger
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

lyx74VAEmvi1vJhrf4DRiw.text: Grabbed a mushroom Swiss double butterburger. Good and sloppy hot burger. Got the spot. Passed on the concrete mixer this afternoon.

09O4MGlUvrKFSHBCJ-RrfQ.text: Overall I love the food at Culver's. The burgers and shakes are great. However the service at the Culver's on University Blvd definitely needs some help.  I sat in the drive through line for at least 5 minutes then actually backed out and went inside to Order. Thanks to the car behind me he let me back out. As I got inside there was no one in line (except me) and 6 people standing behind the counter doing nothing. There needs to be someone giving the people direction (management). So if you are not in a hurry then this Culver's is for you.

u1sGPb1XzPfJ_SsklfzSpw.text: First time to Culver's and it was not good but it was not bad. Culver's in my opinion is another version of Freddy's Steakburger and Custard. Prices are reasonable and the food was average at best although I do love the fact they have the large crinkle fries.   This location is located on an outparcel of Ikea and depending on time or day may or may not be the easiest to access. If you are coming from I-85 will need to make a U-turn or enter the shopping center and work back towards Culvers.

0Zda0mmraJuLi0eQGvjdiw.text: Culver's always brings back fond memories of my living in Rochester, MN. I developed a love for frozen custard and butter burgers.  Each day in Charlotte, I would pass by signs on the highway that said Culver's was close by. I knew that I needed to visit one before going home.  I was delighted to find a Culver's close to where my hotel was. I decided to go through the drive-thru and get some dinner to bring back to the hotel.  The drive-thru is clean and straightforward. I ordered the bacon deluxe butter burger basket with fries and a regular strawberry shake. I then pulled up and paid. I got a number to place on my car's window.  The wait wasn't bad. There was a person ahead of me. Moments later, a person brought my food over. He was friendly and great.  I happily brought my food back to my hotel room after a good shopping day. The bacon deluxe butter burger was perfect. It was juicy and flavourful. It tasted so fresh. I have missed the crinkle-cut fries. They hold the ketchup so perfectly in all the grooves.   The strawberry custard shake hit the spot. You got real chunks of strawberry. It was so good and creamy.  I am so glad that I got my Culver's fix. Next time I am around, I will give eating at the restaurant a try.  (141)

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon deluxe butter burger with fries
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon deluxe butter burger with fries
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top view of strawberry custard shake

vChbz3Mrcl9q4TKtIfSRlQ.text: Lemon Ice is seasonal.   I Promise that line makes me abhor franchises as the Madison, WI, Todd Drive location offers it year round and Fort Mill, SC.   Either way, the service here has been good each visit.  Thought it was a win to have an actual Culver's in CLT.   Sign up for the club to receive deals BUT BEWARE you'll only get the deal from the location you chose as your fav.

cENEfJ_gt-UzLoiou-yfIQ.text: They have a family bucket of fries.  The way they describe thisnoff menu item is hilarious.  Just piling a whole bunch of fries in a box.  They serve up until close, they don't mess around.  These are my favorite steakburger.  The crispy surface of the burger is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Here we are at the fast food.

tVqdwGL7jXjB33KET_gR4A.text: Back in the day, if you wanted to go out for a burger, you pretty much only had McDonald's and Burger King. Sure, you could get a burger at plenty of other places, but they were just different.  Then along came Five Guys and Shake Shack and Smashburger and their variants. And of course if you were on the west coast, you had In and Out and the like. Now you have more of the midwest dairy style, like Culver's and Freddy's.  The primary driver here is certainly the burger - it's something like the smashed style of Smashburger, being that it's not large - but even better is that you can get custard too. And at Culver's, you can even find cheese curds. Nice.  When it comes to the burger, you can get about anything you want on it, and when it comes to desert, it's about the same. Just make sure you order it on hold - that way you don't have to sit there waiting on it for later. You get a receipt that you simply hand them later and they'll make it for you when you're ready and you can eat your burger (and curds) while it's hot, and you get your custard cold. Best of both worlds.

_5FAqjziYanRol6RBPSmQQ.text: Amazing. Inexpensive. Great customer service. Their burgers are marinated and so juicy. Ice cream is so rich and creamy. Would definitely recommend

FDMEaz9ZhOVJ3oBPDJxqXg.text: Culver's was okay. It's definitely a unique chain of fast food. The service is friendly. I wasn't aware after you order and pay at the drive through, you're supposed to pull over to a specific section where they'll bring you your food ( like Sonic drive-in...kind of). I was glad they had fish available as a quick option. It was a simple recipe but not bad, and I was able to get mashed potatoes and greens beans, as a opposed to something fried. If I go back, I'm interested to try their milkshakes and compare them to other fast food restaurants.

ZfmnqhnexFC1A0z7GB6hTA.text: Meh. The good is the nice service and the quality of the beef. The bad is the grease saturating all you eat; and the bland taste to the burger. The tomato was green on the inside and should not have been served. The custard is on the heavy side and overpriced. I prefer the delicate taste of places like Andy's.

fkCHYmemWyyi_0v4eNk3bw.text: One word. Custard! For those who don't know, custard is soft serve ice cream with eggs mixed in. Makes for a creamier yummy taste! They make "concrete mixers" which are basically like a blizzard from DQ. They have many flavors. Sundaes. Shakes. They got it all.   I've been to this location a handful of times, and always has good service, food made to order - coming out hot & yummy. I don't eat out a lot, and rarely "fast food" but this is a pretty good cheap burger and fries! *they have crinkle cut fries by the way, and they are the bomb dot com* (I love fries)   They are known for this custard, burger & fries. But they also have chicken tenders, salads, fish, and soups! I like that they offer side items such as fries, cheese bites, soup, salad, etc. with their combos at no additional charge. So say you want to swap fries for a salad. No problem!   Kid friendly menu, $4.99 includes entree/side/ drink (fountain, chocolate or white milk, juice box)/a scoop of custard with topping which you can use right then and there or wait til another time. Also "scoopie token" it's on the side of kids meal bag. You collect 10 and get to choose a Culvers football, soccer ball, volleyball or "stuffed animal" ice cream cone. I like this better than a wack little toy in each like some places (the yummy custard and choosing a sport related item eventually)

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crinkle cut fries  golden perfection
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buns on point
Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum! Concrete mixers basically like a blizzard from DQ but with custard. (Ice cream with an egg in it, makes for creamier yummy taste)

aOvT6Glrah6bazo22u9dXw.text: The rating is strictly based on the food. My family and I strictly went there for frozen custard because we had a craving for just that. We have never been there before and typically we go to Sonic. We went inside the restaurant is was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The menu look appealing so we ordered the concrete mixer and the special custard of the day. The custard was a very smooth texture but to me the flavor was lacking. I had the butterfinger concrete mixer and it was just okay. I wish I would have saved the calories for sonic or Chick-fil-A lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Culver's - Charlotte, NC, United States

Kw7XLKGedfg4fdQs2XEePA.text: I grew up with Culver's for the past 25 years and am happy to finally get one only 1.5 hours away. I ate lunch here before going to Ikea and then had dessert right after Ikea. While the service wasn't as quick as Culver's in WI, I'm confident they will get faster. I could tell that the team members cared and were trying to be quick / doing everything they could do which is why I gave 5 stars...besides the TASTY food of course.
